poem:
### The Silence of Shadows

In Plymouth's grey embrace,  
a life punctuates the mist.  
Warnings whispered to deaf stones,  
justice sleeps beneath the soil.

Hearts splinter where echoes die,  
streets murmur tales untold.  
The knife knows its path;  
in silence, grief lingers long,  
the shadow cast permanent.
